meanings.definition: A person who quarrels or argues over trivial matters.
meanings.sent1: The squabblers couldn't agree on which TV show to watch.
meanings.sent2: The squabblers in the office argued about who left the coffee pot empty.
meanings.sent3: The squabblers at the party couldn't decide on the best pizza topping.
meanings.sent4: The squabblers in the classroom were like two stubborn goats butting heads.
meanings.sent5: The image of the squabblers bickering over a single cookie was comical.

meanings.definition: To engage in a petty argument or dispute.
meanings.sent1: The siblings squabblers over who gets the front seat in the car.
meanings.sent2: They always squabblers about the smallest things, like whose turn it is to take out the trash.
meanings.sent3: The kids squabblers playfully over who gets to be the captain of their pretend pirate ship.
meanings.sent4: The politicians squabblers endlessly, never reaching a compromise.
meanings.sent5: The neighbors squabblers loudly, disturbing the peace of the whole street.
